[[File:Tea soothingr.jpg|thumb|250px|{{l|ja||茶}} (''cha''): a cup of '''[[tea]]'''.]]

{{ja-kanjitab|ちゃ|yomi=kanyoon}}
From various dialects of {{der|ja|ltc|-|sort=ちゃ}} {{m|zh|茶|tr={{IPAchar|/d̠ʲa/}}}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|-}} reading ''chá'', {{cog|hak|-}} ''chhà'', {{cog|yue|-}} ''caa<sup>4</sup>''.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanyoon|ちゃ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ちゃ}}

# [[tea]] {{qualifier|not used in isolation in modern Japanese}}
# [[brown]]

====Usage notes====
This term is not used on its own in modern Japanese.  For the {{m|en|tea}} sense, this is used either with the honorific prefix {{m|ja|お|tr=o-}}, or in a compound such as {{m|ja|茎茶|tr=kukicha|lit=stem tea}} or {{m|ja|緑茶|tr=ryokucha||green tea}}.
* {{ja-usex|お'''茶'''はいかがですか。|お'''ちゃ''' は いかが ですか。|How about some tea? (Would you like some tea?)}}
For the {{m|en|brown}} sense, this is used with the color suffix {{m|ja|色|tr=-iro}}, as in {{m|ja|茶色|tr=chairo|brown|lit=tea color}}.
